Labs","details":"This contract demonstrates how to integrate AndeChain xERC20 tokens with a bridge Key Features: - Burn tokens on source chain - Mint tokens on destination chain with proof verification - Rate limiting through xERC20 standard - Support for multiple tokens - Emergency pause mechanism Architecture: 1. User calls bridgeTokens() \u2192 burns tokens, emits event 2. Relayer picks up event from source chain 3. Relayer queries Celestia for Merkle proof 4. Relayer calls receiveTokens() on destination with proof 5. bridgeTokens(address,address,uint256,uin.details: Burns tokens on current chain and emits event for relayer

params.destinationChain: Destination chain ID (1 = Ethereum, 137 = Polygon, etc.)

emergencyWithdraw(address,address,uint25.details: Can only be called in emergency mode or after force period

params.sourceTxHash: Original transaction hash from source chain

forceTransaction((address,address,uint25.details: Requires a valid proof and that the forceInclusionPeriod has passed

returns._0: address Bridge address on destination chain

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

receiveTokens(address,address,uint256,ui.details: Only callable by owner (relayer) with valid proof

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._emergencyGracePeriod: New emergency grace period in seconds

params._forceInclusionPeriod: New force inclusion period in seconds

toggleEmergencyMode(string).details: Only callable by owner in extreme situations

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

blobstreamVerifier().notice: Address of Celestia Blobstream verifier contract

destinationBridges(uint256).notice: Mapping of destination chain IDs to their bridge addresses

emergencyClaims(address,bytes32).notice: Mapping of user emergency claims to prevent double claims

emergencyGracePeriod().notice: Emergency grace period - immediate withdrawal window in emergency mode

emergencyMode().notice: Emergency mode flag - when true, users can force immediate withdrawals

emergencyWithdraw(address,address,uint25.notice: Emergency withdrawal function for users when relayer is down

forceInclusionPeriod().notice: Force inclusion period (time after which users can force transactions)

forceTransaction((address,address,uint25.notice: Allows a user to force a transaction if the relayer has not processed it

getDestinationBridge(uint256).notice: Get destination bridge for a chain

isTokenSupported(address).notice: Check if a token is supported

isTransactionProcessed(bytes32).notice: Check if a transaction has been processed

processedTransactions(bytes32).notice: Mapping to prevent replay attacks: txHash => processed

receiveTokens(address,address,uint256,ui.notice: Receive and mint bridged tokens from source chain

setDestinationBridge(uint256,address).notice: Configure destination bridge address for a chain

toggleEmergencyMode(string).notice: Toggle emergency mode - allows immediate withdrawals
